citations.narrative:
The Continency Plan has not been reviewed by the licensee on at least an annual basis. The last review of the
Contingency Plan was completed more than one year ago prior to the April 2023 inspection.
Per this Section, all dealers must review their Continency Plan on at least an annual basis to ensure that it adequately
addresses potential emergency situations that could be detrimental to the health and well-being of the animals. The
Licensee needs to review the Contingency Plan and needs to maintain documentation of all annual reviews of the Plan.
Correct by 9/2/24.

Upon entering 3 of the rabbit housing rooms, a noticeable urine odor was noted by the APHIS inspector. The HVAC
system appeared to be functioning properly to circulate fresh air. The rabbits are housed in enclosures with wire type
floors with a pan filled with wooden shaving under each enclosure. The pans are scraped every other day to remove the
soiled shavings and clean shavings are added. Although all the pans in each of the 3 housing rooms had been scraped
the previous day, the pans of several of the enclosures housing male rabbits in each room were noted to have urine-
soaked shavings present in at least one corner of their pans. A strong urine odor was noted when the APHIS inspector
stood in front of the male rabbits’ enclosures.
Per this Section, the pans under primary enclosures having wire or mesh floors shall be cleaned at least once each week
for the health and comfort of the animals. The presence of urine-soaked shavings in pans under the male rabbit primary
enclosures resulted in a strong unpleasant urine odor in the 3 housing rooms. The pans that contain urine-soaked
shavings should be spot cleaned or cleaned on a more frequent basis to minimize urine odor and for the health of the
animals. Correct by 8/12/24.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representative.
*END OF REPORT*
n

narrative:
2.134(b) 
   
Contingency planning. 
The Continency Plan has not been reviewed by the licensee on at least an annual basis. The last review of the 
Contingency Plan was completed more than one year ago prior to the April 2023 inspection.  
 
Per this Section, all dealers must review their Continency Plan on at least an annual basis to ensure that it adequately 
addresses potential emergency situations that could be detrimental to the health and well-being of the animals. The 
Licensee needs to review the Contingency Plan and needs to maintain documentation of all annual reviews of the Plan. 
Correct by 9/2/24. 
3.56(a)(3) 
   
Sanitation. 
Upon entering 3 of the rabbit housing rooms, a noticeable urine odor was noted by the APHIS inspector. The HVAC 
system appeared to be functioning properly to circulate fresh air. The rabbits are housed in enclosures with wire type 
floors with a pan filled with wooden shaving under each enclosure. The pans are scraped every other day to remove the 
soiled shavings and clean shavings are added. Although all the pans in each of the 3 housing rooms had been scraped 
the previous day, the pans of several of the enclosures housing male rabbits in each room were noted to have urine-
soaked shavings present in at least one corner of their pans. A strong urine odor was noted when the APHIS inspector 
stood in front of the male rabbits’ enclosures. 
 
Per this Section, the pans under primary enclosures having wire or mesh floors shall be cleaned at least once each week 
for the health and comfort of the animals. The presence of urine-soaked shavings in pans under the male rabbit primary 
enclosures resulted in a strong unpleasant urine odor in the 3 housing rooms. The pans that contain urine-soaked 
shavings should be spot cleaned or cleaned on a more frequent basis to minimize urine odor and for the health of the 
animals. Correct by 8/12/24.

This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representative.  
 
*END OF REPORT* 
 
 n
